title: 2015 São Tomé and Príncipe Championship
text:
The 2015 São Tomé and Principe Championship was the 30th season of the <a href="S%C3%A3o%20Tom%C3%A9%20and%20Principe%20Championship">São Tomé and Principe Championship</a> the top-level <a href="Association%20football">football</a> championship of <a href="S%C3%A3o%20Tom%C3%A9%20and%20Principe">São Tomé and Principe</a>. It began on 9 May, a day earlier than last season and concluded on 21 November. Two national final matches occurred in the season. <a href="Sporting%20Praia%20Cruz">Sporting Praia Cruz</a> from <a href="S%C3%A3o%20Tom%C3%A9%20Island">São Tomé</a> island won their seventh and recent title.
Teams.
35 teams participated in the <a href="S%C3%A3o%20Tom%C3%A9%20and%20Principe%20Championship">São Tomé and Principe Championship</a>, 30 from <a href="S%C3%A3o%20Tom%C3%A9%20Island">São Tomé Island</a> (10 in each division) and 5 from <a href="Pr%C3%ADncipe%20Island">Príncipe Island</a>. At the end of season champion of <a href="S%C3%A3o%20Tom%C3%A9%20Island%20League">São Tomé Island League</a> and champion of <a href="Principe%20Island%20League">Principe Island League</a> play one match for champion of <a href="S%C3%A3o%20Tom%C3%A9%20and%20Principe">São Tomé and Principe</a>.
Principe teams 2015.
Five clubs took part in the 2014 season. One of the clubs did not participate in the season. <a href="Sporting%20Clube%20do%20Pr%C3%ADncipe">Sporting Príncipe</a> won the title and participated in the national championship match in November.
Final table.
<onlyinclude></onlyinclude>
National final.
Two national final matches took place on November 15 and 21 at noon. It was another "Sporting" competition as the match featured <a href="Sporting%20Clube%20do%20Pr%C3%ADncipe">Sporting Príncipe</a> from Príncipe and <a href="Sporting%20Praia%20Cruz">Sporting Praia Cruz</a> from São Tome Island.
Sporting Praia Cruz won the first leg 4–2 while Sporting Príncipe won the second leg 2–1. In the first leg, Sporting Príncipe started to lead at the 15th minute after a goal was scored by Arthur, at the 38th minute, Sporting Praia Cruz tied it by Jair and lasted for less than two minutes as Zé changed the lead position to Sporting Praia Cruz at the 40th minute. Inside the second half, once again the match was tied at 2 as Tó scored the half's first goal at the 46th minute. Sporting Praia Cruz kept the lead for the rest of the match, Zé scored his second goal of the match at the 65th minute, in the last few minutes of the match, Jaty scored the fourth goal at the 87th minute. In the second leg, Sporting Príncipe took the lead as Abel scored the match's first goal at the 46th minute, in the second half, a penalty kick was scored at the 73rd minute by Maiê and for approximately seventeen minutes, the total goals of two matches were tied at four. This would change as Sporting Praia Cruz scored the match's only goal at the 90th minute by Jaty and kept the championship hope throughout the remainder of the match. With a total of five goals scored, Sporting Praia Cruz would go on the win their seventh and recent national title.
Sporting Praia Cruz will participate into the <a href="2016%20CAF%20Champions%20League">2016 CAF Champions League</a> in the preliminaries in February.
